summary: chipotle has decided to tap into the $ 70 billion food delivery market by teaming up with an app to bring burritos straight to customers ' doors . the fast-casual chain will work with the postmates app to begin offering delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities . the restaurant plans to add a nine per cent service charge - with the delivery fees for postmates beginning at $ 5 and up depending on distance and demand .

aspect: 1. Mexican restaurant Chipotle partners with Postmates to enter $70 billion food delivery market, adding a nine percent service charge.
2. Chipotle rejects previous offers for collaboration with third-party delivery services but approves a partnership with Postmates app.
3. Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King also expand their delivery services.
explain: Chipotle, a Mexican restaurant, partners with Postmates to enter the $70 billion food delivery market, adding a nine percent service charge for online and mobile orders. Delivery fees through Postmates start at $5 and can vary based on distance and demand.

Chipotle initially declined previously proposed collaboration with third-party delivery services but agreed to collaborate with Postmates app for a delivery service in 67 cities, adding a 9% service charge with delivery fees starting from $5, depending on distance and demand.
Rival fast-food chains Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King are also widening their delivery services to compete with Chipotle.
